intro: Calandrinia andicola var. denticulata, commonly known as the Andean candy flower, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Portulacaceae family, known for its vibrant, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red, pink, and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It features succulent leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Calandrinia andicola var. denticulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
